Schizophrenia loves born in winter and spring

02 Nov 2019, 21:20

Schizophrenia loves born in winter and spring
21:20 11/02/2019 Photo: pixabay.com0
It is worth noting that the month of birth is by no means the only or even any key factor determining the risk of schizophrenia. Because schizophrenia is a whole group of diseases whose nature is very complex.


The Australians found that the risk of developing schizophrenia is significantly higher in those people who were born in the winter or spring months


A large-scale study by Australian scientists showed that there is a clear correlation between the month of birth and the risk of developing schizophrenia. A scientific paper on the topic was published by scientists from the University of Queensland.

Australians found that the risk of developing schizophrenia is significantly higher in those people who were born in the winter or spring months. Why is that? Experts suggest that the thing is the lack of certain vitamins.
“Children born in winter or spring suffer from vitamin D deficiency in the first months of their lives. This substance is produced in the body under the influence of sunlight, and probably plays an important role in the formation of the brain, so there is a noticeable correlation between the month of birth and the likelihood of schizophrenia. But it is worth noting that the month of birth is by no means the only or even any key factor determining the risk of schizophrenia. Because schizophrenia is a whole group of diseases whose nature is very complex, ”the authors of the study note.
The conclusion that the month of birth to some extent determines the likelihood of developing schizophrenia, scientists made based on the analysis of data obtained from more than two and a half thousand people. Now, researchers want to repeat the experiment on a larger sample of data.
Source: Planet Today Schizophrenia Study
